Startup tip: There is no blueprint

Everyone loves rags-to-riches stories, hoping for that one insight that made all the difference. 

It’s the work that makes all the difference. 

If you love the work, you’ll find a way.

For money that you DO make, and whilst you are still focused on building your startup/s, your objective should be to STACK BENJAMINS 💵 

This is the second part of Tip #2:

Be defensive; put money aside for the future.

This can be a full exit, secondary sales along the way …

You’ll either succeed in making a lot of money, or you won’t.

In either case, you’ll either try again, or you won’t.

The point? As a #founder*, you’re already OPTIMISED on Part 1 of Tip #2:

You are 🤞🏼on a >45% pa $$$ compound growth rate trajectory.

Focus on your #startup

Tip for startups working with corporates:

Find a corporate champion. 

This person might be in the BD or innovation arm, or the purchasing business unit. They will bridge the gap between startup-speak and corporate-speak. Two different languages. You need a champ.
